intro: Sebaea tabularis, commonly known as the flatleaf sebaea, is a perennial flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, often succulent leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sebaea tabularis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
